Question: What is Interlibrary Loan and how do I access it?
Answer:
## Request an Interlibrary Loan
Need materials you can't find through University Libraries? Interlibrary Loan is a free service for accessing books, articles and research materials from other libraries.
[Login to request, renew and view materials](https://ill3.tcl.sc.edu/illiad/)

Select your campus and enter your network username and password. First-time users will be prompted to register.

### Making Requests
#### Who is Eligible?
- Currently-enrolled USC Columbia students
- USC Columbia faculty and staff
- UofSC Alumni Association members

#### When to Request
If you have tried [searching](/about/offices_and_divisions/university_libraries/search/index.php) and what you want is not available in the libraries' collections or online resources.

#### What to Request
Interlibrary Loan will try to get any type of research materials  textbooks and other assigned materials for current courses available at the University Bookstore. Some materials may be difficult to obtain.

Question: How do I contact Interlibrary Loan staff?
Answer:
# Contact Us
For additional help check out the [ILL online user guide](http://guides.library.sc.edu/interlibraryloan).
[Interlibrary Loan Staff](/about/offices_and_divisions/university_libraries/about/contact/faculty-staff/index.php?search=Interlibrary)
[uscill@mailbox.sc.edu](mailto:uscill@mailbox.sc.edu)
803-777-2805

Question: What if I'm not a USC Columbia user?
Answer:
# Not a USC Columbia user?
Check a local institution or a local public library for ILL services.
In Columbia:
- [School of Law Library](http://law.sc.edu/library)
- [School of Medicine Library](http://uscmed.sc.libguides.com/)
- [Richland Library](http://www.richlandlibrary.com/)

Question: What modelled data resources are available?
Answer:
#### Modelled Data
- [Parameter-elevation Relationships on Independent Slopes Model (PRISM)](http://www.prism.oregonstate.edu/)
Most of modelled data are stored in NetCDF format. Here is an [introduction](https://www.unidata.ucar.edu/publications/factsheets/current/factsheet_netcdf.pdf) of NetCDF format. Various tools of manipulating NetCDF files found [here](http://www.unidata.ucar.edu/software/netcdf/software.html).
- [MACA Climatology Lab](https://www.climatologylab.org/maca.html)
- [NARCCAP - Climate Change Assessment Program](https://www.narccap.ucar.edu/data/index.html)
- [North American CORDEX Program](https://na-cordex.org/)

Question: What are some resources for social work statistics?
Answer:
## Social Work Statistics and Data Set Resources
Below are some examples of resources that you can use to find social work resources. 
## Statistics
#### International Statistics
- [EUROSTAT](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/data)
- [Human Rights Watch](https://www.hrw.org/)
- [Inter-American Development Bank-](https://publications.iadb.org/discover?thumbnail=false&filtertype_Population+Statistics+%26+Information+Systems=subject_en&filter_relational_operator_Population+Statistics+%26+Information+Systems=equals&filter_Population+Statistics+%26+Information+Systems=Population+Statistics+%26+Information+Systems)Produces working papers on economic and social topics. Resources include:-GEPPAL (an analysis tool with indicators of women's political participation in Latin America)-Latin America and Caribbean Macro Watch Data Tool (Over 500 indicators consolidating data on macroeconomics, social issues, trade, capital flows, markets and governance)-Sociómetro-BID (a dataset of social indicators providing insight into socioeconomic conditions in Latin America).
- [International Organization for Migration](http://www.iom.int/)
- [Our World in Data](https://ourworldindata.org/)
- [UNESCO Institute for Statistics](http://uis.unesco.org/)
- [UN Statistical Resources](http://research.un.org/en/un-resources/statistics)
- [World Health Organization- Country Statisticsc](http://www.who.int/gho/countries/en/)
